isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - CRANKCASE, CRANKSHAFT and BEARINGS, CAMSHAFT and BUSHINGS - Removal - Preliminary Checks

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.
Before removing components in this section, determine gear backlash (crankshaft gear to camshaft gear), camshaft end play, and crankshaft end play.

step1.para: Check and record backlash for camshaft gear-to-crankshaft gear as follows :

note.para: Crankshaft gear must be fixed and not allowed to rotate; the camshaft gear must rotate, for a correct reading.

figure.caption: Gear Backlash check (camshaft gear to crankshaft gear)

step2.para: Mount dial indicator on rear of engine.
Position dial indicator tip on a gear tooth and remove lash.
Rotate gear by hand and read indicator. Record backlash.
If backlash exceeds specified limits , replace camshaft gear.

step1.para: Reposition dial indicator and check camshaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Push camshaft to the front of the engine.
Place a small pry bar between the camshaft gear and crankcase. Lightly pry camshaft forward. Compare dial indicator reading with specifications .

item.para: If end play exceeds specified limits, replace camshaft thrust plate.

step1.para: Check crankshaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Mount dial indicator on crankcase with indicator tip on the end of crankshaft flange as shown.
Pry crankshaft forward with pry bar and zero the dial indicator.
Pry crankshaft back and forth while reading dial indicator.
